January 2 killed five people and caused a
terrible fire. Nearly 400 people
on the Japan Airi plane
promptly evacuated and miraculously escaped.
How did they do it?
Japan Airlines representative
recently reported on the
evacuation process on a passenger plane
at the time of the fire. The flight
attendants discovered the fire and informed the
pilot that smoke had begun to pour into the plane, causing passengers to
passengers panicked But it was the flight
attendants who guided them through
safety steps and to stay calm on a plane with
eight emergency exits. Passengers were
asked to move out through the front two doors,
then out of the remaining six doors there were only
Only one rear left door was not
threatened by fire. According to the procedure, flight attendants
needed permission from the pilot to open
this emergency exit door. However, because the
internal communication system was no longer
working, they continued.  The flight attendants were unable to call the
pilot. The flight attendants proactively
opened this emergency exit door and activated the
emergency slide so that passengers could quickly
escape. They were the
last to leave the plane at 6:50 p.m., completing
the process.  After 18 minutes of evacuation, all 379
people were safe, only a few people were
slightly injured.
